title: 20 IKEA Products Under $1 That Work Suspiciously Well
description: We’ve all been there – walking into IKEA with a specific shopping list, determined to stick to it this time. “Just a new desk lamp,” you tell yourself. Two hours later, you’re pushing a cart full of items you didn’t know you needed, wondering how this happened again. But can anyone blame you? Between the meticulously designed room displays and the marketplace section that feels like a treasure hunt, IKEA has mastered the art of temptation. And then there’s the […] The post 20 IKEA Products Under $1 That Work Suspiciously Well appeared first on IKEA Hackers.
author: Jules Yap
excerpt: While IKEA boasts nearly 50 products priced at just $0.99, we've handpicked 20 absolute standouts that deserve a spot in your shopping cart.
text: We’ve all been there – walking into IKEA with a specific shopping list, determined to stick to it this time. “Just a new desk lamp,” you tell yourself. Two hours later, you’re pushing a cart full of items you didn’t know you needed, wondering how this happened again. But can anyone blame you? Between the meticulously designed room displays and the marketplace section that feels like a treasure hunt, IKEA has mastered the art of temptation. And then there’s the secret weapon: those ingeniously designed items with price tags so low, they make you do a double-take. You know, the ones that make you think, “Well, it’s less than a dollar, so why not?” While IKEA boasts nearly 50 products priced at just $0.99, we’ve handpicked 20 absolute standouts that deserve a spot in your shopping cart. But here’s the thing – unlike most impulse purchases that end up collecting dust, these sub-dollar IKEA finds often become household heroes. They’re proof that sometimes the best solutions don’t need to cost much at all. Here are 20 IKEA products under $0.99 that prove cheap can be fantastic – and yes, they’re probably the reason your “quick IKEA run” never turns out as planned. 1. PÄRKLA Shoe Bag PÄRKLA Shoe Bag | Photo Credit: IKEA.com This simple zippered bag might look basic, but it’s a traveler’s best friend. Made from durable polypropylene, it’s perfect for keeping dirty shoes away from clean clothes in your suitcase. I use it to store my gym shoes so I can easily grab and go. There’s also one permanently in my suitcase so I don’t need to hunt for one when I’m packing for my trips.Other IKEA customers have discovered creative ways to repurpose it. One user cleverly utilizes it to organize her grandson’s art projects, designating a bag for each season and holiday. Another customer uses it to store quilting fabric, separating her supplies by categories. 2. FRAKTA Shopping Bag FRAKTA Shopping Bag | Photo Credit: IKEA.com The iconic blue bag that could probably carry a small car. This indestructible tote is perfect for laundry, moving, or grocery runs. I always keep one in my car for impromptu shopping trips, and it never lets me down. “The bags were well worth the purchase,” a reviewer commented. “I spent $7.05 for a total of 7 bags. I squeezed in 10 winter coats, 25 pairs of shoes and 5 pairs of boots and 10 outfits in the bags purchased.” 3. PRICKIG Microwave Lid PRICKIG Microwave Lid | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Save yourself from countless microwave cleanup sessions with this splash guard. The vents prevent steam buildup while keeping your microwave spotless. What I like is the height of the lid; it’s tall enough to prevent contact with food, ensuring optimal heating and less clean-up. I use it daily when I heat milk for my coffee and have even threaded a twine through the holes to hang it conveniently on the cabinet door next to the microwave. 4. TACKAN Soap Dispenser TACKAN Soap Dispenser | Photo Credit: IKEA.com This minimalist dispenser looks far more expensive than its price tag suggests. It’s glass, not plastic, which is a win. The pump mechanism is surprisingly durable and it has become my go-to for hand soap in the bathroom. My only complaint is the pump dispenser can be finicky; it requires a bit of control to dispense the right amount of liquid. 5. UPPFYLLD Peeler UPPFYLLD Peeler | Photo Credit: IKEA.com A basic peeler that makes quick work of vegetables. The stainless steel blade maintains its edge impressively well. I love that it has a solid handle that doesn’t feel like cheap plastic. I’ve prepped countless potato dishes with this little wonder. However, it does blunt after months of use. At $0.99 I guess I cannot expect it to last forever. 6. SUNNERSTA Container SUNNERSTA Container | Photo Credit: IKEA.com These hanging containers are perfect for organizing small items in tight spaces. The clever hook design means no drilling required. The SUNNERSTA containers have been frequently hacked into interesting items, like behind-the-door storage organizers, even a shopping cart cup holder. They also slot right into the sides of a RÅSKOG or RASHULT cart.I’m less ambitious and have merely created a mini hanging garden on my LURÖY bed slat rail system using a few of these containers. Drill a few holes on the bottom of the SUNNERSTA, fill with soil and plant away. 7. YUPPIENALLE Phone Holder YUPPIENALLE Phone Holder | Photo Credit: IKEA.com This simple yet effective phone stand which I keep on my key ring. What’s great is that it is usable in two positions, with slots to hold up your phone in portrait or landscape mode. It’s perfect for video calls on-the-go — no more propping my phone on the coffee mug. Plus, it’s great for binge-watching videos during solo dinners as the viewing angle is just right. 8. VILJESTARK Vase VILJESTARK Vase | Photo Credit: IKEA.com This charming glass vase features a delicate swirl design, making it perfect for single stems or small bouquets. But its versatility doesn’t stop there. IKEA customers have creatively repurposed it as a candle holder, a decorative centerpiece for tables, a candy dish, and even a stylish storage solution for small items in the bathroom or on their desks. 9. NOJIG Organizer NOJIG Organizer | Photo Credit: IKEA.com These drawer dividers are the secret to keeping small items in check. The modular design lets you create custom configurations. Get a few of these and transform your junk drawer from chaos to order – no more hunting for paper clips. You can also use these as desk drawers under a monitor stand. 10. TILLGÅNG Tray TILLGÅNG Tray | Photo Credit: IKEA.com A versatile plastic tray that’s perfect for serving or organizing. The raised edges prevent spills, and it’s dishwasher safe. The size is good for two or three plates and bowls, which is just what I need for those dinners in front of the TV. (I know, bad habit). Other customers have found creative uses for it as well. One user shared, “We purchased these trays to help my 95-year-old mother work on jigsaw puzzles. They’re light enough for her to lift and move around as she sorts the pieces.” Another has repurposed it as an affordable plant tray to catch drips. 11. DRÖNJÖNS Pencil Cup DRÖNJÖNS Pencil Cup | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Beyond keeping your writing utensils organized and easily accessible, some customers have used it to hold makeup brushes or kitchen utensils. Quilter clips and rotary cutters fit in these as well. Another creative user plants her orchids in these wire pencil holders. It’s definitely way cheaper than regular wire baskets for orchids. 12. TJABBA Magazine File TJABBA Magazine File | Photo Credit: IKEA.com A magazine file is a magazine file. But IKEA still manages to give it its own twist. With the TJABBA, you get a smiley face cut-out — definitely a perk-me-up for the office space. A simple file holder that works well for organizing papers and magazines. However, they are made of lightweight cardboard, so don’t expect them to hold heavy books or lots of documents. 13. SNÖSKYFFEL Shoe Horn SNÖSKYFFEL Shoe Horn | Photo Credit: IKEA.com I’ve only recently discovered the true benefits of a shoe horn while trying on winter boots. (This one is my favorite!) The SNÖSKYFFEL hits all the right notes. It’s made of metal so it’ll last for years. It can be easily hung on a hook or packed away in a suitcase. Plus, it’s a vibrant red, which adds a fun pop of color. 14. MEDELVÅG Bottle Brush MEDELVÅG Bottle Brush | Photo Credit: IKEA.com The perfect tool for cleaning water bottles and vases with narrow necks. The bristles are firm enough to scrub but won’t scratch delicate surfaces. It’s become indispensable for cleaning my collection of reusable water bottles. I love that it has a long handle compared to other bottle brushes.If you love eclectic decor, you can also hack it into a pendant lamp. Yes, you read that right. 15. FIKADAGS Mixing Bowl FIKADAGS Mixing Bowl | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Probably the cheapest mixing bowl ever. The size is perfect for small batches of pancake batter or salad dressing. A user notes: “They are lightweight so I can put them on the scale and zero it out before weighing things. They don’t take up a lot of space.” Another says the kids love using it for popcorn! 16. SEKINER Door Hook SEKINER Door Hook | Photo Credit: IKEA.com These metal over-the-door hooks are robust enough to hold coats yet slim enough to ensure the door closes properly. Their metal construction makes them suitable for use over bathroom doors as well. The design features a larger hook for jackets or bulkier items and a smaller hook for lighter items like tea towels.Just a quick note: be sure to measure the thickness of your door before purchasing, as these hooks may not fit all door types. 17. FÄRGRIK Mug FÄRGRIK Mug | Photo Credit: IKEA.com These sturdy ceramic mugs come in cheerful colors and stack beautifully. They’re microwave and dishwasher safe, making them perfect for daily use. The size is just right for my morning latte. One standout feature is the drainage slot on the bottom rim, which allows water to escape when the mug is upside down in the dishwasher, preventing any accumulation.More than that, you can use these mugs to create a festive candle holder and pendant lamps. 18. POKAL Glass POKAL Glass | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Simple, stackable glasses that look timeless and feel substantial in hand. They survive countless dishwasher cycles without clouding. While I don’t own a set of POKAL glasses, I’ve used them at many cafes and restaurants and they’ve always felt and looked stylish. No one suspected they cost a mere 99 cents.Want to use them for hot drinks? Make crochet sleeves for the glasses to comfortably hold them, even with hot liquids. Or hack them further into spice jars with these 3D-printed lids. 19. ÄNKEBLOMSTER Wine Glass ÄNKEBLOMSTER Wine Glass | Photo Credit: IKEA.com Surprisingly elegant wine glasses at an unbeatable price. The classic shape works well for both red and white wines. They’ve handled many dinner parties with grace, and at this price, I don’t stress if one breaks. 20. SLIBB Hanger with Grip Clips SLIBB Hanger with Grip Clips | Photo Credit: IKEA.com These hangers with clips are perfect for odd items like scarves or beanies and other small garments. The wavy coarse teeth on the clips are gentle on fabric but grip firmly. The flat design makes it easy to bring when traveling. I’m definitely packing one for my next trip. So, the next time you find yourself at IKEA, don’t forget to pick up these $0.99 items. When you find one that works well for you, consider buying multiples because it’s worth having backups of your favorites, especially when it’s at this fantastic price point. And we don’t know when IKEA will discontinue them.Which are your favorite 99-cent IKEA products? Let us know in the comments.
html:
We’ve all been there – walking into IKEA with a specific shopping list, determined to stick to it this time. “Just a new desk lamp,” you tell yourself. Two hours later, you’re pushing a cart full of items you didn’t know you needed, wondering how this happened again.

But can anyone blame you?

Between the meticulously designed room displays and the marketplace section that feels like a treasure hunt, IKEA has mastered the art of temptation.

And then there’s the secret weapon: those ingeniously designed items with price tags so low, they make you do a double-take. You know, the ones that make you think, “Well, it’s less than a dollar, so why not?” While IKEA boasts nearly 50 products priced at just $0.99, we’ve handpicked 20 absolute standouts that deserve a spot in your shopping cart.

But here’s the thing – unlike most impulse purchases that end up collecting dust, these sub-dollar IKEA finds often become household heroes. They’re proof that sometimes the best solutions don’t need to cost much at all.

Here are 20 IKEA products under $0.99 that prove cheap can be fantastic – and yes, they’re probably the reason your “quick IKEA run” never turns out as planned.

1. PÄRKLA Shoe Bag

This simple zippered bag might look basic, but it’s a traveler’s best friend. Made from durable polypropylene, it’s perfect for keeping dirty shoes away from clean clothes in your suitcase. I use it to store my gym shoes so I can easily grab and go. There’s also one permanently in my suitcase so I don’t need to hunt for one when I’m packing for my trips.

Other IKEA customers have discovered creative ways to repurpose it. One user cleverly utilizes it to organize her grandson’s art projects, designating a bag for each season and holiday. Another customer uses it to store quilting fabric, separating her supplies by categories.

2. FRAKTA Shopping Bag

The iconic blue bag that could probably carry a small car. This indestructible tote is perfect for laundry, moving, or grocery runs. I always keep one in my car for impromptu shopping trips, and it never lets me down.

“The bags were well worth the purchase,” a reviewer commented. “I spent $7.05 for a total of 7 bags. I squeezed in 10 winter coats, 25 pairs of shoes and 5 pairs of boots and 10 outfits in the bags purchased.”

3. PRICKIG Microwave Lid

Save yourself from countless microwave cleanup sessions with this splash guard. The vents prevent steam buildup while keeping your microwave spotless. What I like is the height of the lid; it’s tall enough to prevent contact with food, ensuring optimal heating and less clean-up.

I use it daily when I heat milk for my coffee and have even threaded a twine through the holes to hang it conveniently on the cabinet door next to the microwave.

4. TACKAN Soap Dispenser

This minimalist dispenser looks far more expensive than its price tag suggests. It’s glass, not plastic, which is a win. The pump mechanism is surprisingly durable and it has become my go-to for hand soap in the bathroom.

My only complaint is the pump dispenser can be finicky; it requires a bit of control to dispense the right amount of liquid.

5. UPPFYLLD Peeler

A basic peeler that makes quick work of vegetables. The stainless steel blade maintains its edge impressively well. I love that it has a solid handle that doesn’t feel like cheap plastic. I’ve prepped countless potato dishes with this little wonder.

However, it does blunt after months of use. At $0.99 I guess I cannot expect it to last forever.

6. SUNNERSTA Container

These hanging containers are perfect for organizing small items in tight spaces. The clever hook design means no drilling required. The SUNNERSTA containers have been frequently hacked into interesting items, like behind-the-door storage organizers, even a shopping cart cup holder. They also slot right into the sides of a RÅSKOG or RASHULT cart.

I’m less ambitious and have merely created a mini hanging garden on my LURÖY bed slat rail system using a few of these containers. Drill a few holes on the bottom of the SUNNERSTA, fill with soil and plant away.

7. YUPPIENALLE Phone Holder

This simple yet effective phone stand which I keep on my key ring. What’s great is that it is usable in two positions, with slots to hold up your phone in portrait or landscape mode. It’s perfect for video calls on-the-go — no more propping my phone on the coffee mug. Plus, it’s great for binge-watching videos during solo dinners as the viewing angle is just right.

8. VILJESTARK Vase

This charming glass vase features a delicate swirl design, making it perfect for single stems or small bouquets. But its versatility doesn’t stop there. IKEA customers have creatively repurposed it as a candle holder, a decorative centerpiece for tables, a candy dish, and even a stylish storage solution for small items in the bathroom or on their desks.

9. NOJIG Organizer

These drawer dividers are the secret to keeping small items in check. The modular design lets you create custom configurations. Get a few of these and transform your junk drawer from chaos to order – no more hunting for paper clips. You can also use these as desk drawers under a monitor stand.

10. TILLGÅNG Tray

A versatile plastic tray that’s perfect for serving or organizing. The raised edges prevent spills, and it’s dishwasher safe. The size is good for two or three plates and bowls, which is just what I need for those dinners in front of the TV. (I know, bad habit).

Other customers have found creative uses for it as well. One user shared, “We purchased these trays to help my 95-year-old mother work on jigsaw puzzles. They’re light enough for her to lift and move around as she sorts the pieces.” Another has repurposed it as an affordable plant tray to catch drips.

11. DRÖNJÖNS Pencil Cup

Beyond keeping your writing utensils organized and easily accessible, some customers have used it to hold makeup brushes or kitchen utensils.

Quilter clips and rotary cutters fit in these as well. Another creative user plants her orchids in these wire pencil holders. It’s definitely way cheaper than regular wire baskets for orchids.

12. TJABBA Magazine File

A magazine file is a magazine file. But IKEA still manages to give it its own twist. With the TJABBA, you get a smiley face cut-out — definitely a perk-me-up for the office space. A simple file holder that works well for organizing papers and magazines. However, they are made of lightweight cardboard, so don’t expect them to hold heavy books or lots of documents.

13. SNÖSKYFFEL Shoe Horn

I’ve only recently discovered the true benefits of a shoe horn while trying on winter boots. (This one is my favorite!) The SNÖSKYFFEL hits all the right notes. It’s made of metal so it’ll last for years. It can be easily hung on a hook or packed away in a suitcase. Plus, it’s a vibrant red, which adds a fun pop of color.

14. MEDELVÅG Bottle Brush

The perfect tool for cleaning water bottles and vases with narrow necks. The bristles are firm enough to scrub but won’t scratch delicate surfaces. It’s become indispensable for cleaning my collection of reusable water bottles. I love that it has a long handle compared to other bottle brushes.

If you love eclectic decor, you can also hack it into a pendant lamp. Yes, you read that right.

15. FIKADAGS Mixing Bowl

Probably the cheapest mixing bowl ever. The size is perfect for small batches of pancake batter or salad dressing. A user notes: “They are lightweight so I can put them on the scale and zero it out before weighing things. They don’t take up a lot of space.” Another says the kids love using it for popcorn!

16. SEKINER Door Hook

These metal over-the-door hooks are robust enough to hold coats yet slim enough to ensure the door closes properly. Their metal construction makes them suitable for use over bathroom doors as well. The design features a larger hook for jackets or bulkier items and a smaller hook for lighter items like tea towels.

Just a quick note: be sure to measure the thickness of your door before purchasing, as these hooks may not fit all door types.

17. FÄRGRIK Mug

These sturdy ceramic mugs come in cheerful colors and stack beautifully. They’re microwave and dishwasher safe, making them perfect for daily use. The size is just right for my morning latte. One standout feature is the drainage slot on the bottom rim, which allows water to escape when the mug is upside down in the dishwasher, preventing any accumulation.

More than that, you can use these mugs to create a festive candle holder and pendant lamps.

18. POKAL Glass

Simple, stackable glasses that look timeless and feel substantial in hand. They survive countless dishwasher cycles without clouding. While I don’t own a set of POKAL glasses, I’ve used them at many cafes and restaurants and they’ve always felt and looked stylish. No one suspected they cost a mere 99 cents.

Want to use them for hot drinks? Make crochet sleeves for the glasses to comfortably hold them, even with hot liquids. Or hack them further into spice jars with these 3D-printed lids.

19. ÄNKEBLOMSTER Wine Glass

Surprisingly elegant wine glasses at an unbeatable price. The classic shape works well for both red and white wines. They’ve handled many dinner parties with grace, and at this price, I don’t stress if one breaks.

20. SLIBB Hanger with Grip Clips

These hangers with clips are perfect for odd items like scarves or beanies and other small garments. The wavy coarse teeth on the clips are gentle on fabric but grip firmly. The flat design makes it easy to bring when traveling. I’m definitely packing one for my next trip.

So, the next time you find yourself at IKEA, don’t forget to pick up these $0.99 items. When you find one that works well for you, consider buying multiples because it’s worth having backups of your favorites, especially when it’s at this fantastic price point. And we don’t know when IKEA will discontinue them.

Which are your favorite 99-cent IKEA products? Let us know in the comments.
